title: Introduction to odbr
text: can install development version odbr CRAN : can install development version odbr GitHub :
code: # install from CRAN install.packages("odbr") library(odbr) # or use the development version with latest features devtools::install_github("hsvab/odbr") library(odbr)

title: Introduction to odbr
text: package currently includes 2 main functions download census data: read_od() read_map() odbr also includes support function help users navigate databases, providing convenient information data variables data dictionaries 3 languages (English - en, Portuguese Brazil - pt, Spanish - es): read_dicitionary() syntax odbr functions operate logic becomes intuitive download data set using single line code. Like :
code: library(odbr)  # Return data from OD Surveys database as data.frame df <- read_od(   city = "Sao Paulo",   year = 1977,   harmonize = FALSE ) #> Downloading file to: /tmp/RtmpbF38lY/od_sao_paulo_1977_not_harmonized.csv.gz  # Return zone data from OD Surveys database as sf object at a given city and year df <- read_map(   city = "Sao Paulo",   year = 1977,   harmonize = FALSE,   geometry = "zone" ) #> Downloading file to: /tmp/RtmpbF38lY/zone_sao_paulo_1977_not_harmonized.gpkg  # Return data dictionary from OD Surveys, as data.frame, at a given city and year df <- read_dictionary(   city = "Sao Paulo",   year = 1977,   harmonize = FALSE,   language = "pt" )

title: Introduction to odbr
text: original geodetic reference system remained unchanged. harmonized data available yet. harmonized datasets use geodetic reference system “SIRGAS2000”, CRS(4674).

what: Download Data from Brazil's Origin Destination Surveys
title: Download Data from Brazil's Origin Destination Surveys
text: odbr R package download data Brazil’s Origin Destination Surveys. package provides databases, maps, data dictionaries English, Portuguese, Spanish. Furthermore, possible download harmonized data across different cohorts city.

title: Download Data from Brazil's Origin Destination Surveys
text: can install odbr Package : can install development version odbr GitHub :
code: # install from CRAN install.packages("odbr") library(odbr) # or use the development version with latest features devtools::install_github("hsvab/odbr") library(odbr)

title: Download Data from Brazil's Origin Destination Surveys
text: syntax odbr functions operate logic becomes intuitive download data set using single line code. Like :
code: # Return data from OD Surveys database as data.frame library(odbr)  df <- read_od(   city = "Sao Paulo",   year = 2017,   harmonize = FALSE ) #> Downloading file to: /tmp/RtmpjicoRU/od_sao_paulo_2017_not_harmonized.csv.gz  # Return zone data from OD Surveys database as sf object at a given city and year df <- read_map(   city = "Sao Paulo",   year = 2017,   harmonize = FALSE,   geometry = "zone" ) #> Downloading file to: /tmp/RtmpjicoRU/zone_sao_paulo_2017_not_harmonized.gpkg  # Return data dictionary from OD Surveys, as data.frame, at a given city and year df <- read_dictionary(   city = "Sao Paulo",   year = 2017,   harmonize = FALSE,   language = "pt" )

Metadata for the package — metadata

what: Download data dictionary from OD surveys databases — read_dictionary
title: Download data dictionary from OD surveys databases — read_dictionary
text: Return data dictionary specific Origin Destination Survey, available. dictionary intended used understand data downloaded using odbr::read_od function. contain list variables , variable, simple description, available categories class (factor, numeric, etc).

title: Download data dictionary from OD surveys databases — read_dictionary
code: read_dictionary(   city = "São Paulo",   year = 2017,   harmonize = FALSE,   language = "pt" )

title: Download data dictionary from OD surveys databases — read_dictionary
text: city Character. City reference. Defaults "São Paulo". year Numeric. Year reference format yyyy. Defaults 1977. harmonize Logical. FALSE (Default), function returns raw data. TRUE, function returns harmonized data city, across years. language Character. language data dictionary opened. Options include c("pt", "en", "es").

title: Download data dictionary from OD surveys databases — read_dictionary
text: "data.frame" object.

title: Download data dictionary from OD surveys databases — read_dictionary
code: library(odbr)  # return data dictionary from OD Surveys, as data.frame, at a given city and year df <- read_dictionary(   city = "Sao Paulo",   year = 2017,   harmonize = FALSE,   language = "pt" )

what: Download spatial data from OD Surveys databases — read_map
title: Download spatial data from OD Surveys databases — read_map
text: read_map() download geodetic data specific Origin Destination survey return sf dataframe. uses cached data file previously downloaded avoid extra networking consumption. understand returned dataframe format, please reefer read_dictionary() function survey cohort. also necessary specify geometry granularity wanted, "municipality", "district" "zone" level details. course, geometries available surveys.

title: Download spatial data from OD Surveys databases — read_map
code: read_map(city = "São Paulo", year = 2017, harmonize = FALSE, geometry = "zone")

title: Download spatial data from OD Surveys databases — read_map
text: city Character. City reference. Defaults "São Paulo". year Numeric. Year reference format yyyy. Defaults 1977. harmonize Logical. FALSE (Default), function returns raw data. TRUE, function returns harmonized data city, across years. geometry Character. type spatial data opened. Options include c("zone","district", "municipality").

title: Download spatial data from OD Surveys databases — read_map
text: "sf" "data.frame" object

title: Download spatial data from OD Surveys databases — read_map
code: library(odbr)  # return zone data from OD Surveys database as sf object at a given city and year df <- read_map(   city = "Sao Paulo",   year = 2017,   harmonize = FALSE,   geometry = "zone" ) #> Downloading file to: /tmp/RtmptpOsvf/zone_sao_paulo_2017_not_harmonized.gpkg  #' # return district data from OD Surveys database as sf object at a given city and year df <- read_map(   city = "Sao Paulo",   year = 2017,   harmonize = FALSE,   geometry = "district" ) #> Downloading file to: /tmp/RtmptpOsvf/district_sao_paulo_2017_not_harmonized.gpkg  # return municipality data from OD Surveys database as sf object at a given city and year df <- read_map(   city = "Sao Paulo",   year = 2017,   harmonize = FALSE,   geometry = "municipality" ) #> Downloading file to: /tmp/RtmptpOsvf/municipality_sao_paulo_2017_not_harmonized.gpkg

title: Download microdata from OD Surveys databases — read_od
Download microdata from OD Surveys databases — read_od
text: city Character. City reference. Defaults "São Paulo". year Numeric. Year reference format yyyy. Defaults 1977. harmonize Logical. FALSE (Default), function returns raw data. TRUE, function returns harmonized data city, across years.

title: Download microdata from OD Surveys databases — read_od
text: "data.frame" object.

code: library(odbr)  # return data from OD Surveys database as data.frame df <- read_od(   city = "Sao Paulo",   year = 2017,   harmonize = FALSE ) #> Downloading file to: /tmp/RtmptpOsvf/od_sao_paulo_2017_not_harmonized.csv.gz
